didoss@... wrote:
> We (internally) created a DynamicTestSuiteBuilder that builds up the 
> suite based on the directory that it is packaged in..."The test runner 
> will run all tests in the package directory and in any subdirectories."
> 
> It is based on extending a common class.  It is possible that a similar 
> construct could be done in your environment to distinguish between "all 
> Db tests" and "all non-Db tests", depending on how you make that 
> distinction.

Did you know about GSBase's "RecursiveTestSuite" or JUnit-addons' 
"DirectorySuiteBuilder"? If you did, then did you folks build something 
neat that they didn't? If not, and you'd like to remove some potential 
maintenance cost, take a look. Arbitrarily, I'd choose JUnit-addons over 
GSBase, just because the rest of the package is a bit more complete. (No 
offence, Mike.)
